metadata.synopsis: Astartion starts the dialog lying on his bedroll, looking up at the stars. He's somewhat pensive, reflective, thinking that he might lose the ability to walk in the sun - even if it means ultimately saving his life. He gets up and is complImentary towards us, but he gets uncomfortably close and his compliments have a hungry feel to them. Really he's thinking that later tonight he'll come back and drink our blood. He excuses himself, but he's sure that tonight's the night he's going to feed.

58.speaker: Astarion
58.text: Do you mind? I was rather enjoying my view of the ceiling.
58.context: CinematicNodeContext: The player stands over Astarion, who is lying on his bedroll, thinking. He is not looking at the stars

47.speaker: Astarion
47.text: It's something of a novelty. I'm usually quite busy at night, but now I'm just lying here and thinking.

6.speaker: Player
6.text: Pardon, I didn't mean to disturb such important work.

9.speaker: Astarion
9.text: I'll forgive you. I'm mostly just thinking anyway.

25.speaker: Astarion
25.text: The stars, I mean. I could take or leave your chin.

63.speaker: Astarion
63.text: Reflecting on what tomorrow might bring, when we find the druid.

43.speaker: Astarion
43.text: Will he know how to bring the worm under control? Will this little adventure of ours be over?

5.speaker: Astarion
5.text: Reflecting on what tomorrow might bring, when we meet this goblin priestess.

2.speaker: Astarion
2.text: Will she know how to bring the worm under control? Will this little adventure of ours be over?

28.speaker: Player
28.text: It doesn't have to be. We can still travel together.

78.speaker: Astarion
78.text: Good! I don't want you to run off just yet.

8.speaker: Player
8.text: Probably. Once the worm is gone, I'm going my own way.

62.speaker: Astarion
62.text: You're quite the ally, after all. Traversing Avernus. Surviving the crash. Surviving everything that's followed...

13.speaker: Astarion
13.text: You've been to the Hells and back. Survived the crash. Survived everything that's followed.

59.speaker: Astarion
59.text: I'm not easily impressed by people, but you're stronger than I gave you credit for.
59.context: CinematicNodeContext: ~Astarion approaches towards the player, getting a little too close. [reuse]

61.speaker: Astarion
61.text: You have your charms... more than you think.

51.speaker: Narrator
51.text: *The smile on his pretty lips is a touch too composed, a bit too perfect. He may not mean a word he says.*

4.speaker: Player
4.text: Perhaps we should get to know one another better...

55.speaker: Player
55.text: I thought you didn't like me.

23.speaker: Player
23.text: I'm just trying to survive. Like you.

26.speaker: Astarion
26.text: Yes, we're more similar than I thought...

80.speaker: Astarion
80.text: Hmm? Oh, I was leagues away. I just need to...

75.speaker: Astarion
75.text: I'll see you later, I'm sure. Sleep tight.
75.context: CinematicNodeContext: ~Astarion lies back down on his bedroll [reuse]NodeContext: He's thinking about sneaking back into camp and drinking your blood tonight. Sleep tight should be said with a smirk.

56.speaker: Astarion
56.text: ...I just need to get some air. Clear my head.

39.speaker: Player
39.text: Just don't try to bite me again. It won't go well for you.

34.speaker: Astarion
34.text: Heavens forbid. I've learned my lesson. I just...

36.speaker: Astarion
36.text: Sleep tight. I'll see you later, I'm sure.
36.context: CinematicNodeContext: ~Player turns and walks away. [reuse]NodeContext: Called after someone walking away.

16.speaker: Player
16.text: I have many talents. If you want to explore them...

70.speaker: Player
70.text: But? What are you waiting for?

30.speaker: Astarion
30.text: ...I'm sorry, I - I need to clear my head.

72.speaker: Astarion
72.text: Hmm? Yes! Of course, me too.

64.speaker: Astarion
64.text: I think I'll just - just clear my head.

67.speaker: Player
67.text: Just keep your eyes away from my neck.

45.speaker: Astarion
45.context: CinematicNodeContext: He doesn't move.NodeContext: Smug, quiet, he's still right in her face.

49.speaker: Astarion
49.text: I was just going anyway. I need to clear my head.
49.context: NodeContext: Smug, quiet, he's still right in her face.

21.speaker: Astarion
21.text: I'm sure I'll see you when I get back. Sleep tight.
21.context: CinematicNodeContext: ~He steps back with a smug smile, then turns and leaves. [reuse]

54.speaker: Astarion
54.text: Reflecting on what tomorrow might bring, when we arrive at this gith crèche.

37.speaker: Astarion
37.text: Will we find out how to bring the worm under control? Will this little adventure of ours be over?

46.speaker: Astarion
46.text: Reflecting on what tomorrow might bring, when we get to this hag's teahouse.

69.speaker: Astarion
69.text: Reflecting on what tomorrow might bring.

40.speaker: Astarion
40.text: I can see the stars from Baldur's Gate, of course, but not with such clarity. It got me thinking.
